attributes.action: make it a requirement that all notices of court action may not be deemed served, unless sent by recorded delivery
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
At present, Councils,banks, Debt Collection Agencies, HM Government agencies etc. can assume that citizens have been served with notices simply because a letter has been entrusted to the postal service. There is no requirement upon them to ensure that the notice has actually been received by the recipient. 

The minimum requirement should be that recorded delivery is used so that a proof of delivery is available to the court as an audit of due process. Furthermore, wherever possible, an email should be sent in parallel.

I can think of no reason why any reputable company or agency would disapprove of this change. 

Please support this petition, thank you.
